input.text: A new meta-analysis found that choice-architecture nudges (e.g., defaults, reminders, framing) produce a small-to-moderate average effect on behavior across many domains, with substantial heterogeneity by context and implementation quality.

output.text: A meta-analysis reports that behavioral nudges typically yield small-to-moderate improvements, though results vary widely depending on context and implementation.
